summary: The Fighting Fibers Act of 2025 mandates that all new washing machines sold in the United States contain a microfiber filtration system, effective January 1, 2030. The bill defines the filtration system and outlines specific mesh size requirements or equivalent efficacy standards determined by the EPA. It also requires a consumer-visible label regarding filter maintenance. Furthermore, the bill directs the Administrator of the EPA to conduct a nationwide study on the presence, impact, and pathways of microfibers in the environment and human health, including a report to Congress within a year. Civil penalties are outlined for violations.
